intro: Androstylium fockeanum, commonly known as the Fockean sandmat, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Aizoaceae, commonly referred to as the ice plant family. The plant is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and small, star-shaped flowers that bloom in spring. It thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is adapted to arid environments. Due to its unique appearance and ecological role, it is often cultivated in xeriscapes and rock gardens.
